repnme.cdata!:
Burkina Faso - First, Second, Third,
            Fourth, Fifth, Sixth Poverty Reduction Support Credit Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the First, Second, and Third
            Poverty Reduction Credit Project (PRSC) for Burkina Faso are
            as follows: outcomes of the project were satisfactory,
            sustainability is likely, and the performance of the Bank
            and the Borrower was also rated satisfactory. Ratings for
            the Fourth, Fifth, and Sixth Poverty Reduction Credit
            Project for Burkina Faso are as follows: outcomes of the
            project were satisfactory, sustainability is moderate, and
            the performance of the Bank and the Borrower was also rated
            satisfactory. The lessons learned from the report are: 1)
            PRSCs are useful instruments to help the borrower assume
            increased responsibility in managing its public resources in
            an efficient manner, notably by providing more flexibility
            and predictability; however, there is a risk of complacency
            and of dependence on continued foreign budget support; 2)
            issues of attribution are inevitable when the reform
            programs are supported by several donors; 3) since outcomes
            are to be assessed after several years, the quality of the
            relevant statistical data is critical; if insufficient,
            preparation should include remedial actions, including the
            selection and definition of baseline data; 4) since reforms
            are of medium-to long-term nature, early identification of
            institutional weaknesses and capacity constraints is of
            paramount importance; and 5) to assess outcome of a
            medium-term program, it is essential that the different
            documents of a PRSC series be consistent in content and
            format, including statistical series and other data.

repnme.cdata!:
Burkina Faso - The Second Poverty Reduction
            Support Credit Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Poverty Reduction Support Credit
            (PRSC)-(2) Project for Burkina Faso had the following
            ratings:  the outcome was satisfactory, the sustainability
            was likely, the institutional development impact was
            substantial and the Bank and borrower performance were both
            satisfactory.  The findings and implications for subsequent
            operation(s) in series indicate that overall, the
            satisfactory progress made since the approval of PRSC-2
            warranted the move to PRSC-3; that PRSC-2 could not be also
            aligned with the budget cycle as previously sought, and this
            should be a priority in the next operation; and that more
            attention should be paid in the subsequent operations,
            starting with PRSC-1, on capacity building in line
            ministries given the focus on improving service delivery.

repnme.cdata!:
Burkina Faso - Second Poverty Reduction
            Support Credit Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Second Poverty Reduction Support
            Credit Project, is an integral part of the Country
            Assistance Strategy (CAS), to support the implementation of
            the Poverty Reduction Strategy Paper (PRSP), and, the second
            in a series of three planned operations for FY02-03. The
            project is designed to help the Government achieve better
            outcomes in public resource management by: 1) strengthening
            program budgets, linking allocations to specific sector
            objectives, strategies, and action plans; 2) improving
            service delivery in education, health, and rural
            development; and, 3) strengthening the fiduciary framework,
            to promote accountability, and transparency in the use of
            public funds, including external aid. Nonetheless, the main
            risks to this operation, and its reform program, come from
            political instability, vested interests, and fiduciary and
            institutional issues. However, to minimize those risks,
            reforms are being implemented in a sensitive context, and in
            participation with opposition parties in the political
            dialogue; and, notwithstanding vested interests, and
            fiduciary risks regarding the use of public funds, such
            should be mitigated to a substantial extent by the design,
            and content of the project, given that the supported, main
            reform measures, will have been taken prior to Board
            presentation, and, by the fact that substantial technical
            support will be provided.

repnme.cdata!:
Burkina Faso - Second Poverty Reduction
            Support Credit Project : environmental assessment

abstracts.cdata!:
The Second Poverty Reduction Support
            Project builds on the previous operation, and further
            develops the program, by supporting reform policies,
            particularly regarding the use of public funds for public
            service delivery, specifically, to the poor, through
            increased access to, and expansion of quality education,
            and, through modernized agricultural development practices.
            This environmental assessment stipulates the need for
            preparing a three-year capacity building plan regarding
            environmental protection, establishing units at line
            ministries, to help screen sectoral investments for the
            integration of environmental, and social safeguards,
            supported by technical advise from specialized institutions.
            Sectoral mitigation measures, thus address: 1) agricultural
            and livestock issues will follow environmental guidelines as
            set within the Decentralized Rural Development APL operation
            recently launched, which contains an environmental
            management plan covering agricultural safeguards; 2) the
            HIV/AIDS Response operation also contains a medical wastes
            management plan, that constitutes a guide for relevant
            investments, and practices in the health sector; and, 3)
            included in the Basic Education Project, is an environmental
            analysis, that provides the framework for mitigating adverse
            environmental aspects, which could guide the investment
            management plan. Careful attention will be given to
            monitoring environmental and social impacts.

docna.cdata!:
Burkina Faso - Second Poverty Reduction
            Support Credit Project : environmental assessment
